intro: Alyssum lusitanicum, commonly known as the Portuguese alyssum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has compact, hairy leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Alyssum lusitanicum is also valued for its resilience in dry conditions and its ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
